credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
title: Design for the West Wall of the Music Room, for Brighton Pavilion
medium: Brush and watercolor, gouache, over traces of graphite on white wove paper
description:
Elevation of west wall, with the two large wall paintings of bamboo trees and pagodas flanking the fireplace. The wall panels are flanked by paintings of Chinese columns entwined by serpents. The coved section is shown above on seperate piece of paper, with three lozenge-shaped painted glass panels. Alternative design painted underneath.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory.
name: Drawing
